title: CAN YASUO JUNGLE? and  WHY YASUO CAN't JUNGLE?
body: Most people use{{champion:157}} as mid or supp . {{champion:157}} dosent need mana and the cooldown is very low why cant we use it as a jungler?

replies.body: No one said you can't use him for jg but he has a lot of trouble in jg ganking wise(unless lane has a knock up) and early farming(especially if you don't get a leash).

He's really squishy, doesn't do too well without targets to dash around for escape and creep block with. 
He also doesn't get as much farm and has a slightly delayed powercurve with having to buy Hunter's Machete later with one of the tier 3 jungler items.
Well i didn't really say he was a good jungle in fact i recommend not using him in jg
My comment was to compliment/add to yours.

Your first question in your title is 'Can Yasuo jungle' but your second question in the title already assumes you cannot jungle with Yasuo.
Your description also follows the same trait.

That makes me cringe
Can Yasuo really supp??? I've actually seen top and ADC Yasuos... But never a supp.
then you have never met me in game ;)

Okay, we got one guy.

Anyone else?

 I just don't get how Yas supp works...

it works only when a boss plays it

But basically, seeing as bot lane is usually ranged harass your w comes very handy in protecting yourself and your adc from poke while also being able to trade back. Building a relic shield makes your job even easier, healing up whatever the adc does end up taking through your wall. Taking exhaust makes eliminating the enemy adc as easy as pie. Due to yasuo's high mobility and shield, this makes it easy to dash quickly to the enemy adc (or supp) for a quick eq combo then dashing back out on the wake of a w, making hurting you for a substantial amount near impossible. if its too risky to eq around, stack q up on high health minions(or minions you exe to heal adc) to then wind up a whirlwind, then using the cc it provides to give your adc the opportunity to either heavily damage or even kill the hit enemy. If you can hit a 1/2-3/4 health enemy adc with whirlwind, going in on with r and exhaust makes their chance of survival around about 10-15% (unless they have tahm) because this allows their adc to be 2v1 banged with reduced damage and defence, while under the effects or around 2 second knockup/suppress combo. And you just build yasuo, with a mix of some supp in there. Enjoy rekin like a boss, if you have the mechanical skill to use yasuo like a boss that is.

> [{quoted}](name=Talon12,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=gQZ2sxEq,comment-id=0001000000000001,timestamp=2015-07-27T11:04:46.054+0000)
>
> seeing as bot lane is usually ranged harass your w comes very handy in protecting yourself and your adc from poke while also being able to trade back. Building a relic shield makes your job even easier, healing up whatever the adc does end up taking through your wall.


That 13 sec cd at max lvl of w and windwall isn't that good, unless you verse blitzcrank or thresh or naut mabye morgna
in another words I'm saying Yasuo would be good as a counter to other sups (but morrg may not be a good one has her ult is a laser yasuo's w doesn't stop lasers)

the only problem for a yasuo vs morg is her e, reducing the openings for his ult. Because of yasuo high mobility, and that most fights like that occur around minion waves, yasuo can easily dash out of her ultimate range, then chucking back his q to ult whoever doesn't have her e on them, yasuo does well if he is moving fast so its hard for the enemy team to keep track of what he is doing

also most people don't believe because its hard to do, but if you time your w right you can block nauts ulti (time it to overlap one of the mini wakes will cancel it.)
it works only when a boss plays it

No sustain, clearing camps is fairly limited and the jg items limit his kit.

Plus his ganks suck
